message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV

This paper is about neural language modeling, which is a subfield of natural language processing (NLP) in computer science. The paper proposes a novel neural language model that can simultaneously induce the syntactic structure from unannotated sentences and leverage the inferred structure to learn a better language model. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which is dedicated to the study of computational models of natural language and their applications. 

The paper also mentions the use of recurrent neural networks (RNNs) and tree-structured recursive networks, which are common in machine learning and deep learning. Therefore, the paper may also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), which are sub-categories that cover topics related to machine learning and AI. 

Additionally, the paper mentions the use of gradient back-propagation, which is a common optimization technique in neural networks. Therefore, the paper may also belong to cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing), which covers topics related to neural networks and evolutionary algorithms. 

Finally, the paper mentions the use of character-level language model tasks, which may involve image recognition or computer vision. Therefore, the paper may also belong to cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition), which covers topics related to computer vision and image processing.
